action.name: Validation
action.helpHtml: This action lets you set benchmarks for carrying out operations. Similar to the Logic action, this action will actively stop further actions from executing until an action is met. A pass action will resume the given action if it is met, such as moving to the next page of a form, and a fail action will keep the user on the same page and trigger some kind of change, such as displaying a validation error.

property.name: Controls
property.helpHtml: Sets the control/s on the page to validate against.

property.name: Apply styling
property.helpHtml: Sets whether to apply a validation style to the selected controls.

property.name: Stop further actions
property.helpHtml: Sets whether to prevent further actions from being carried out on the page or not, such as progressing to the next page on a form.

property.name: Pass actions
property.helpHtml: Sets actions to be carried out for when validation has passed.

property.name: Fail actions
property.helpHtml: Sets actions to be carried out for when validation has failed
